s1.content: King of the Jews; I'm honestly not sure. Another ten years, I suppose?

s2.content: Somehow he is to be the perfect sacrifice... Am I a sinner too? (psst! Psalm 40:6–8)

s3.content: Legend has it that the Messiah would speak in parables - I wonder the implications! (psst! Psalm 78:1–2)

s4.content: The scriptures prophesize of several miracles performed by the Messiah - I await excitedly for his appearance. (psst! Isaiah 35:5–6)

h1.content: Ah, King of the Jews, you say? Hmm.. how interesting.

a.content: What say you, those who seek; may receive! Let us call together all the chief priests and teachers of the law, so that we may discover the birthplace of such a great Messiah!

h2.content: Ah, the town of Bethlehem! Praise be his name.

a.content: Go and search carefully for the child. As soon as you find him, report to me, so that I too may go and worship him.

warning2.content: Do not be afraid, dear Magi. I have been sent from the Holy one above to brief you of the coming of the Messiah.

a.content: Let it become necessary to NOT report back to the king. For he is wicked and the Messiah's safety must be assured.

b.content: Peace and grace be to you all who believe in our Lord who is to be named Jesus Christ.

end.content: And so, the gifts of gold, frankincense, and myrrh were given to the Son of God. Praise be his name.

a.content: And you, as the Magi, return back in secrecy, not alerting Herod, the wicked.
